name: Introduction to Psychology
description: Explore the scientific study of mind and behavior, including perception, learning, and memory.

name: Principles of Sociology
description: Learn how societies are structured and how individuals interact within them.

name: Introduction to Political Science
description: Study political systems, governance, and public policy.

name: Economics for Beginners
description: Understand supply, demand, markets, and how economies function.

name: Cultural Anthropology
description: Examine how cultures shape human experience and social behavior.

name: Human Geography
description: Study human populations, urban development, and spatial organization.

name: International Relations Basics
description: Understand global politics, diplomacy, and international organizations.

name: Social Psychology
description: Discover how individuals' thoughts, feelings, and behaviors are influenced by others.

name: Research Methods in Social Sciences
description: Learn how to design, conduct, and analyze social science research.

name: Development Studies
description: Explore issues in economic development, poverty, and globalization.

name: Public Administration
description: Understand how government institutions implement policies and serve citizens.

name: Criminology and Criminal Justice
description: Study crime, law enforcement, and the criminal justice system.

name: Behavioral Economics
description: Learn how psychological insights influence economic decision-making.

name: Gender and Society
description: Explore gender roles, inequality, and cultural representations of gender.

name: Urban Sociology
description: Investigate how urban environments shape human interactions and communities.
